file_content.text: You know, you've really been impressing me. We need a hundred people like you, and instead we've got....
...well, we've got Sanju. Pretty Sanju, who's always been a little squeamish.
What are you trying to say?
Meaning what?
Yeah, Chemish. What are you saying?
I'm saying you've become a liability.
I've seen enough of him to judge. Sanju isn't a bad guy.
Squeamish, but loyal.
You're too kind.
Actually, Sanju's the worst kind of operative.
Frankly, he shouldn't even be here.
Agreed. He's a problem.
What? What did I do to you?
Nothing. It's what you did to me.
Sorry about that. Would've taken care of him earlier, but I thought you should be here.
I never did trust that man.
Good call.
I caught him duplicating the list of collaborators. He had this coming.
What was that about?
I don't understand.
Sanju was one of us. You just go ahead and murder him?
You monster!
Don't get all righteous.
Since you joined up, Sanju's been acting strange. He seemed nervous about the power cores, and I caught him duplicating the list of collaborators.
I've been suspicious of him for a long time. And now that I have you, I don't have to risk keeping him around.
So where do we go from here?
I see.
I'm only sorry I couldn't kill him myself.
He was a piece of filth.
I'll save someone for you next time.
You had no proof he was a traitor! You can't just kill people based on suspicion.
That's no reason for murder.
I had what I needed to make a decision. Learn to respect that.
Back to business. I need you for a special job, and it's an important one. You know our leader, Gray Star?
The regular recruits don't ever meet him, and there's a reason: Gray Star operates from inside the Republic military base. It's a secret the Empire never figured out.
Why tell me these things now?
You trust me with this?
I don't understand. I thought Gray Star was independent.
Is Gray Star Republic?
Gray Star is Balmorran. He fought for Balmorra against the Empire. He joined the Republic troops because he had nowhere else to go.
But the Republic doesn't know that one of their soldiers is our leader. If they find out, they'll lock him up--they're not our friends, and they never will be.
I'm with you so far.
Agreed.
They hate the Empire as much as we do. Why shouldn't they be an ally?
Why not?
Balmorra used to be a part of the Republic. Then the Republic abandoned us to the Empire. We're not going back.
Let me guess--we need to keep the Republic ignorant?
I see where this is going.
I got a message from Gray Star--he thinks the Republic is watching him. He's decided to come join us.
We need to extract him from the Republic base at the Balmorran Arms Factory. Which means you go inside and get him out.
The Empire can't find a battle cruiser in a starfleet.
No surprise there.
They're not stupid. We're only around because we take precautions.
The Republic doesn't know the truth either. If they realized one of their soldiers was our leader, they'd lock Gray Star up.
But they are getting suspicious. You need to extract Gray Star from the Republic base at the Balmorran Arms Factory. He's coming to join us.
After Gray Star's free--what's my next move?
Then what?
You won't regret sending me, Chemish.
I promise I'll succeed.
Never thought I would.
You expect me to march into a Republic fortress to rescue one man?
That's suicide.
I expect you to show some commitment.
When the job's done, lie low for a bit. I don't want to overexpose you.
Gray Star and I will set up a new safe house and contact you when we have an assignment. All clear?
You better not be planning to ditch me. We've got more work to do.
We'll meet up again?
Don't worry, Gray Star will want you around for a long time.
I'll head out immediately.
Completely clear.
It'll be a long march to the Republic base. Good luck--and thanks for all you've done.
Looks like I don't need you anymore--time to end this.
Clear we're through. [Attack]
What are you doing? You son of a--!
You don't come in here, fail twice in a row and expect to get away with it.
I, uh--
Time to die, traitor.
Watch out!
You know all about the way the Empire and the Republic have been using our planet as a battleground. Pretty obvious stuff.
Normally, the Republic doesn't bother us--they've got other worries. But I need someone to get inside the main Republic base.
It won't be simple, but you've come to the right person.
I can do it.
Good attitude.
Why do you want to get in there?
What for?
If you want "someone" to walk into enemy territory and get shot to death, you're talking to the wrong person.
That's crazy.
If I thought you couldn't do the job, I wouldn't bother sending you.
I need you to make a drop to one of our friends in the Republic ranks. Get past the guards, get inside and make the delivery. That's it.
I guess I'll just have to trust you.
All right.
What delivery? Who am I looking for?
I need more information.
You're starting to annoy me, Chemish.
I'm not happy about this.
You want to work with us, you need to get used to not knowing every little detail.
She's right--just part of the setup. Don't get offended.
Here's the package and the coordinates of your target. He'll know what to do once you make the delivery.
We're clearing out of this safe house, so I'll contact you once we've settled somewhere else. And be careful at the base--they find you, they kill you.
Believe me, I can handle a few soldiers.
The job will get done.
You're not going to tell me anything else?
That's all you'll say?
Don't push it. You're still new here.
Blow up a few Imperials for me, will you?
Have fun while I'm gone.
Not a problem.
See you in a while. If you make it back alive, I can promise--we'll be working together a lot.
We'll talk soon. Watch yourself.
You made it to the outpost okay. Good. Sanju was just showing me the data you sent back.
In fact, you did the job pretty well. There's just one little problem.
Everything went fine on my end.
What problem?
Is that right? Then explain something.
Tell me, and we'll solve it together.
Let's figure it out.
Fine. Listen up.
The only problem here is you, Chemish.
Don't give me that garbage.
Yeah. Maybe my standards are just too high.
I had a list of collaborators on the outpost computer. Sanju downloaded the list and gave it to me. All good so far.
Then I hear that the Imperials are posting extra security around my targets. Someone must have tipped them off. Someone who also sabotaged my power cores.
Calm down, Chemish--I didn't have anything to do with it.
Don't look at me.
Sanju's the only one who knew enough to sabotage us. It was him.
It must have been Sanju.
Stop thinking so hard--you'll hurt yourself.
You really are an idiot.
Shut up.
But now the Imperials are posting extra security around my targets. Looks like there's a leak inside my organization. Any ideas?
I've been busy with your missions. Why are you asking me?
How should I know?
You're new here. I thought fresh eyes might be a help. Maybe not.
You're implying I'm responsible.
Are you accusing me?
I'm not implying anything. I'm just letting you in on the situation. Consider it a warning.
Sanju knows enough to cause trouble. Could've been him.
Maybe Sanju.
What? Hey, what did I ever do?
It could be Sanju. It could also be you. Could be all sorts of people. It could even be a coincidence.
Gray Star will know how to handle this. For now, I need your skills for a special job; I don't have anyone else who can do it.
So, you made it back. You did good work out there--all the data's intact.
Did Sanju tell you those computers had a list of Imperial collaborators? You helped us expose traitors.
Now that you know their names, what happens?
What will you do with them?
They get what's coming to them. That's all.
Does this prove that I'm on your side?
Have I passed your tests yet?
Proof doesn't exist in this business. You know that.
There's never proof, but I don't have so many doubts anymore.
They're the worst kind of scum. I hope they get what they deserve.
Cowards and turncoats.
They will. I can pretty much promise that.
You know, you had me worried when those power cores didn't work. I'm still not sure what to make of you.
But you're doing alright, and I need your skills for a special job. I don't have anyone else who can handle it.
Just say the word, Chemish. I'm in.
Name it.
Sounds like you're starting to rely on me.
Guess you're lucky I'm here.
If that's what it sounds like, then that's what it sounds like.
What would you do if I refused?
And if I say "no"?
I'd fail to get the mission accomplished. That answer your question?
You going after the training camp or not?
You seen the caves in this valley? Dark and cramped, but they make a nice hiding place. Scanners bounce right off them.
Useful for all sorts of things.
Invisible to scanners, huh?
Seemed like a good discovery.
I assume you're telling me this for a reason.
Go on.
You make them sound so charming. I'll have to pay them a visit.
Not a vacation spot.
Yeah. You will. I was getting to that.
Gray Star set up a training outpost in the caves a while back. Then the Empire started dropping gas bombs on the Republic.
The outpost was poisoned. Toxin got into the soil, turned good kids into drooling psychos, and the caves were overrun by our own people.
You said it was a training outpost--what kind of training outpost?
What was the hideout for?
Place we took angry recruits and taught them how to shoot a blaster, use a stimpack--nothing fancy.
There's got to be a way to flush the toxin out of your people, restore their sanity.
Can we cure them?
Early on, maybe there was. It's way too late now.
Give the word, and I'll secure the place for you. Drooling killers or not.
I could take the caves back.
You don't think small, do you? Huh. Tempting, but no.
We're willing to cut our losses, but there's still data on the outpost computers. I want it transmitted out and the systems destroyed.
Sanju, get to high ground outside of town. You can pick up the signal with a booster box.
Is all this clear? The toxin victims will be after you--but get that data wiped, or we're finished.
Is all this clear? Getting the data won't be easy--but you managed the factory, so I figure you can survive the outpost.
I know what I'm doing. I'll make it through the caves.
All clear, Chemish.
What's so important about the computers?
About this data I'm getting...
That's none of your business. You just do your job.
When are you going to let me shoot some Imperial skulls?
I'd rather fight the Empire.
Give it time.
Now get out of here. I've got to figure out what we're going to do without those power cores....
Now get out of here. I've got some power cores to pass around and an attack to plan.
Back already? Your friend is quick, Sanju.
Told you she was good.
Told you he was good.
You tell me a lot of things. But I asked for the stealth droid power cores. If you don't have them, you're wasting my time.
Right here, Chemish--the full crate, all yours.
I have them.
Spare me the attitude. I want to work with you. Here.
I only want to help.
Huh. Looks like you actually made it to the factory.
I had to melt down half an army of droids to get this. Better be worth it.
Take the stupid crate.
Sure you did, hero.
It'll take a minute to get this case open. Sanju, go fetch Pyther and a droid....
I think we've got it, Chemish. Crack the case open, and let's see if our new friend did the job right.
Looks like everything's here. Except--what's this?
The readouts say the power cores are fried! What did you do?
I went in there and got the case like you asked.
I followed instructions.
That case was sitting there for a long time. Looks like the power cores decayed.
They must've gone bad.
You can't blame me--I didn't do anything!
It's not my fault!
You don't get to make excuses--not to me, and definitely not now.
Chemish, come on, there are plenty of ways those things could've gone bad.
It's suspicious, but... power cores are pretty fragile.
Yeah. Yeah, okay. Bad luck can happen to anyone--once.
You said yourself that you need people. Let me try again.
Then give me a chance.
All I want is a chance to fight for our cause.
I swear I'm loyal.
I don't need to put up with this garbage. Listen--
This is absurd.
Fine. I'll give you one more shot, but you better make this work.
Looks like everything's here. The power cores read fully functional. Hmm... this is nice--very nice.
Glad I managed to help in the fight.
Good.
Imperial bodies'll be piling up in Sobrik. Don't you worry.
This mean I'm one of you, now?
Have I proved myself?
Not exactly. But it means we can strike against Sobrik, and that wins you points.
I think it's time to blow up some Imperials.
They'll spread some carnage.
I agree. It is about that time, isn't it? I'll make the arrangements.
You realize I wasn't expecting much--didn't know if you were really for the cause, didn't know if you had the skills.
Still not sure how far I can trust you--but you've got the talent.
I take it you have another job in mind?
So what's next?
I swear, I'll show you I believe in the cause.
I'll earn your trust.
I don't need your promises, but I'm ready to see where this goes.
I've got talents you haven't even dreamed of.
You don't know the half of it.
Ha! Yeah, maybe you're right. We keep working together, and maybe I'll find out.
While my people are fixing up the power cores and planting them around Sobrik, you'll be doing something different.
You want to help us, you get me those power cores.
Get out of my face.
What are you doing here?
Don't try anything.
